abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column offers hope that Pennsylvania clothing and textile scion Peter D Barbey's purchase of foundering newspaper Village Voice will return it to former significance; holds Barbey's commitment to great writing and strong voice is what made paper great in first place.
lead_paragraph: After years of decline, the Village Voice has been bought by a wealthy Pennsylvanian. Can he restore the glory of a paper built on a passion for argument and a business plan that relied on raunch?

headline.main: Sale Raises Hopes for Reviving The Village Voice

snippet: After years of decline, the Village Voice has been bought by a wealthy Pennsylvanian. Can he restore the glory of a paper built on a passion for argument and a business plan that relied on raunch?
